text: "Previous patients got sick, but it wasn't clear at the time whether it was due to the T cells or an infection," said pediatric oncologist Stephan Grupp, who oversaw Emily's care at Children's Hospital of Philadelphia. "Now we know the main reason they were sick was the cells. But now we can intervene. She taught us."
title: University of Pennsylvania gene therapy shows promise in eradicating some blood cancers

meta_data.description: A 7-year-old pixie named Emily Whitehead has erased any remaining doubts about the power of a University of Pennsylvania gene therapy to eradicate certain blood cancers.
